description: DeDemolition of existing garage and erection of new 2 storey side and rear extension.
decision_conditions: You are advised of the necessity to consult the Principal Highways Engineer of the Highways team on drw@lambeth.gov.uk in order to obtain necessary prior approval for undertaking any works within the Public Highway including Scaffold, Temporary/Permanent Crossovers, Oversailing/Undersailing of the Highway, Drainage/Sewer Connections and Repairs on the Highways, Hoarding, Excavations, Temporary Full/Part Road Closures, Craneage Licenses etc. You are advised to contact the Highways team at the earliest possible opportunity.
This decision letter does not convey an approval or consent which may be required under any enactment, by-law, order or regulation, other than Section 57 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

By virtue of the increase in bulk and massing to the side of the existing dwelling 129 Clarence Avenue, the proposed two-storey side extension would unbalance the pair of semi-detached properties thus adversely detracting from their architectural character and appearance and the contribution the pair make to the integrity of the design of the wider grouping of semi-detached properties along Clarence Avenue. As such the proposal would subsequently detract from the character and appearance of the locality, contrary to policies Q5 and Q11 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021) and the guidance as contained within the Council's Building alterations and extensions SPD 2015.

Insufficient information has been submitted demonstrating that the proposed development would not cause harm to the health and stability of nearby trees, contrary to Policy Q10 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021).
